description.narrative: Output 3 [Emergency Coordination and Strategy for the North] : The Government sets up systems to prevent and respond to risk- sensitive crises and communities strengthen their resilience to humanitarian crises, which contributes to Child Health, Child Protection And Emergencies, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Education In Emergencies, Health And Emergencies, Nutrition And Emergencies, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: [Cross-Sectoral Support Programme]: Policymakers have access to and use regularly updated data and analyses, and vulnerable populations have access to quality information and adopt behaviours favourable to the rights of the child.

mailing-address.narrative: BP 96 Niamakoro Route de l'Aeroport Bamako

sector.narrative: HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Humanitarian planning and review activities (HRP, RRP, UNICEF HAC)

UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3 [Emergency Coordination and Strategy for the North] : The Government sets up systems to prevent and respond to risk- sensitive crises and communities strengthen their resilience to humanitarian crises

description.narrative: During this period, efforts of the section were based on the preparedness of emergency situations, notably flood. This led to the update of contingency plans (flood and other risks) and the prepositioning of WASH and NFI items in regions. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/08/2016

title.narrative: # de regions qui ont un systeme d'alerte precoce renforc

actual.value: 2016:La région de Mopti dispose du système d'alerte précoce opérationnel. Son extension dans d'autres villages est prévue en 2017.

title.narrative: # d'activites de l'Unicef incluant Plan d'Action National sur la reduction de risque

target.value: 2015:Le plan est developpe et pris en compte dans les activites sectorielles de l'Unicef

actual.value: 2016:Le plan d'action n'est pas encore développe.

title.narrative: # de regions qui ont les capacites de la prevention et de la reponse a l'Ebola et aux autres epidemies

target.value: 2015:Les 4 regions/zones les plus vulnerables (Sikasso, Koulikoro, Kayes, Bamako)

actual.value: 2016:Les capacités de prévention ont été légèrement améliorée suite au prépostionnement des intrants de contingence, cependant, des efforts restent à faire.

title.narrative: Mecanisme de coordination humanitaire interministerielle de facon regulier existant

actual.value: 2016:Les réunions se sont tenues mais de façon irrégulière, à cause de l'utilisation non indiquée du Conseiller Spécial par le Ministre.

title.narrative: # de regions qui ont des plans de contingences et mesures de preparation aux urgences (y compris un stock de contingences)

target.value: 2015:Les 4 regions dans le nord (Mopti, Gao, Tombouctou, Kidal)

actual.value: 2016:Hormis Kidal où l'accès reste très difficile, les régions de Tombouctou, Gao et Mopti ont leurs plans de contingence à jour.
